NPA3gWGUJOYsXPcyshnwzA.text: Not bad. Yes it is messy.The place is a little off the norm. But, hey I am from California. That is the way I like it!

sRdhUxbSuy1kxGJvD8w6OA.text: Recently the place started to have lunch service. To promote its lunch during its first week till 22 May 2016, it was offering burgers at $7 each during lunch times (including the weekends). It was great deal considering that the burgers cost between $18 to $24 each. The place was packed with mostly families during the Sunday lunch time. It looked kind of colorful and bright, instead of the usual dark and loud place it usually was at night. Remember to help yourself to the condiments such as mustard and Tomato Ketchup, as well as, the kitchen towel on the table.Red Chili Burger ($24)Beef patty, beef chili, cheese, jalapenos, French's mustardIt looks kind of dry when served. I wish it was served with dripping chili. Kind of disappointing.Buffalo Chicken Burger ($20)Fried chicken fillet slathered in house-made hot pepper sauce, lettuce, red onions, blue cheese sauceIt looked super spicy, overflowing with red sauce. It was sinfully juicy and greasy. We had Hard Shakes to go with the burgers.Chendol Shake ($18)Abuelo Anejo Rum, Coconut Cream, maple, vanilla ice creamPandan flavoured and milky with alcoholic aftertaste, although I wish there was some green chendol jelly in it too.Salted Caramel & Bourbon ($18)Bourbon, sea salt, caramel, vanilla creamThick creamy milkshake with alcoholic aftertaste, but a bit difficult to drink with the thin straw.Overall the food and drinks were filling, even although the burgers looked kind of smaller this time.

qCnwPtecBpd3jj70L81n-w.text: No doubt about it: looks-wise, this place is hot shit. I think it sets itself apart from a lot of other places in the area because it's dark and edgy (but not dingy.) There's really cool art on the walls, and the lit up letters spelling "Singapore" across the bar and kitchen are pretty effing cool.Food-wise, I thought it was okay. I had the dead hippie burger, which was made up of 2 mustard flavoured patties. Honestly, the mustard wasn't very strong. I also tried the cheese fries, which were not covered in cheddar like I expected. I didn't read the menu so I'm unsure what cheese they used, but it was a white cheese that didn't melt very well so there would be chunks of cheese here and there and lots of uncovered fries.They do have a strong drinks menu, though. Cocktails take up almost an entire page, and my boss, who knows her beer, recognised a lot that was on the beer list.Music was very loud, so be prepared to raise your voice over songs like Peaches' "F*ck The Pain Away". If you know this song, I'd say it pretty much sums up the attitude of this place.The food isn't mind blowing, but it's definitely a cool place to be seen. If you don't mind shelling out a few dolla dolla billz to be in a cool spot, then go for it. Just know that they only take reservations for 10 people or more!

photos.caption: Photo of MEATliquor - Singapore, Singapore. Our feast for 4!
Photo of MEATliquor - Singapore, Singapore. Here's what to expect, decor-wise.
Photo of MEATliquor - Singapore, Singapore. Cool wall art.

F71tQu0Fke0Cuk20BpRA1A.text: For something that's lauded as a popular burger joint from London, i have to say i've never heard of it and i've been to London twice. Granted one does not exactly look for a burger when one visits the city, does one?Anyways...Get the dead hippie burger. The sauce is to die for (heh heh). It says 2x the patty, but even though you do get two patties i think the overall volume of beef is still the same as other burgers. Maybe the double patty is to serve as more surface area for the sauce? Whatever it is... It works for me. So, some may disagree with me and some may even consider this comparison to the God of american burgers to be blasphemous, but this burger reeeerally reminds me of a cleaner version of In-n-out animal style (I KNOW RIGHT?). At least, this is the closest i've gotten to that taste since I moved away from socal.We also got the chili cheese fries to share. Which can easily feed three people. The chili was a bit dry but definitely packs a punch in flavor. It was pretty spicy even for my standard (i love spicy) but not unbearable.Huge bonus for them: protein style (replace bun with lettuce) is available right off the menu. I miss being able to order this without having to specifically ask for it and getting odd looks from the server...Another draw of the place is its decor and ambience. Definitely fitting to be the new resident of Duxton Hill.

photos.caption: Photo of MEATliquor - Singapore, Singapore. Chili cheese fries

cWrpxE_Ef98hlqmPdE4bCA.text: My initial introduction to MEATliquor was through deliveroo, and after trying a couple of burgers since I've been here, I'd have to say this one def. stands out.  I've tried a couple of different ones, but the plain jane cheeseburger is my favorite.  Don't mess with the old classic, I'd say.  Their onion rings are also bomb, but their fried pickles leave a little to be desired.  I like my pickles in slices fried, not one big spear, but it's a matter of preference.  The next time I ran into Meatliquor was on the way to spin, so I thought I would completely blow my kick ass workout and pop in for a burger.  The place is pretty cool, good crowd, and nice cocktail list.  Decent prices, and solid burgers.  I'll continue to be a fan :)

1qlnTj-TXG6KVtYArYSa_Q.text: The place was fairly crowded on a Friday night, usual Duxton crowd. They took about 20-30 minutes to deliver our orders, thankfully my pals and I were in a fairly good mood. The spot we were at had blaring music, which made conversations difficult. The burgers and fries look and sounded better than it actually tasted. The patty was undercooked and they actually didn't ask for done-ness.Yeah, overall not recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of MEATliquor - Singapore, Singapore. Chili cheese fries plus two underwhelming burgers
Photo of MEATliquor - Singapore, Singapore. Green chili burger, just pass

S4vJLmu0gO9x-vhGsW1lVg.text: Finally, a bad*ss blues, rock, and punk tavern in Singapore with proper buffalo wings, incredible burgers, and IPA micro-brews on the menu!!!I've found a new home. Reminds me of home (lower Manhattan). Go here. Eat, drink, be extraordinarily happy.

photos.caption: Photo of MEATliquor - Singapore, Singapore. Green chili cheese burger. Incredible.

GcTGPc42eLLiHW53-2o13A.text: My British friend giggles like a teenage girl every time I say the name of this place... Fitting then, that this is a British import to the Singapore dining scene...I like to imagine that the owner experienced an epic trip one night somewhere down in bayou country and created the ambiance of the restaurant based on his foggy, neon laced recollections...Rock, blues and honky tonk tunes blare while stylish wait staff prowl the floor with cut offs and fashions straight out of the closet of Dukes of Hazard era Jessica Simpson...On both visits, service has been snappy and attentive... Prices are high for burgers, but in the stylish environs, perhaps fitting...Burgers are well built and tasty and the onion rings are sized more appropriately for the Indomitous Rex than the humble Homo Sapien... Not that I'm complaining, they are thrillingly large and wonderfully crispy!Drink list is thoughtful and fun, but definitely priced in line with an upscale cocktail bar... Bring your plastic!No one was dancing, but the music screams for an impromptu dance party!  Maybe next time!PARTING THOUGHT: if you think of Meat Liquor as a fun night out, throw caution to the wind and splurge, but if you are bringing your McDonald's budget here, you'll be sad...

5wH0iJG_1l2Ub84v0t3DxA.text: If after eating a burger there's no mess, it wasn't a good burger - is something I happen to believe in. This places embraces it, and then some. The kind you gotta clean you're arms to your elbows once you're done eating. The burgers are undoubtedly quite good,  extremely juicy and delicious. I had the Bacon Cheeseburger and enjoyed it. My friend went with the server recommended Dead Hippie and she liked her's as well. We grabbed ourselves some Shambal Fries that weren't to my liking, but my friend enjoyed them.Strong cocktail list as well. Quite extensive, you'll find something for your self. Quirky decor and unusual music choices make for an interesting atmosphere. Does feel a little pricey, but if that doesn't bother you, go for it. It's the cool place to be.

h4qUIp7blZzDCGMpKM0jNg.text: Just as good as their chain in London!!! Good selection of drinks and even though the menu is small,  the servings are just enough. Good place for groups of 2 or more. Wouldn't recommend coming alone since the burgers are quite filling and if you want a sife it makes more sense to share dome chips with someone else instead!!

zuLI5kfgvlNIkYWyoC903w.text: Burgers delivered a good taste and a responsive bun. So I give it a 4 star burger. Fried pickles tasted delightful too. I miss deep southern american comfort foods. The music was too loud for any conversation and we had to wait a while, so I knocked it down to a 3 star rating. Our meal was free as well because we won a game at the restaurant. So I cannot complain about price this time.

NtZ24JkiNMwvVFLXpXkTeQ.text: For a burger joint to setup here from London, they either have to be really ballin', or have an ace up their sleeve.It must be the former.Just getting a table was an experience in child labour. My freind arrived before I did and asked to be put on the waiting list, but said I had to show up as well, to be placed on the list. Ok, she was now pissed off. Then we were asked to wait for about 20minutes for a table. We got one 15 minutes after. Yippeeeeee!!!The food was basic. Shrimp covered in batter, with 'cajun' spices, (I need to bring my bottle of spice the next time I go there), buffalo wings, and double patty burger, paleo style. Sauce? What sauce?I think the beef patty was the same quality to Potato Head. Which is why I stopped going there ages ago.Including a beer, the total bill was $84!Eeeeks!The place reeked of a cheesy, american diner, with owners who have a lot of creativity, and no art gallery to put it in.Even more eeeeeeks!The music was blaring loud. Rock, I think that noise was, and the tables were tightly spaced together. On the plus side, the servers were super attentive and detailed in order taking. Yes, that matters. I still consume no dairy, so, I asked for no cheese, and no bread. They gave me a huge piece of lettuce, and delivered my order correctly.Please. Don't waste your time and money.

cQ2YLFVedYYoXd-j6ue2dw.text: If this is a great spot for burgers in London, then London must have some pretty low standards. Meh all around. Food was terrible. So were drinks. $$$ and not worth a cent. So many better places to have both.

vfhxfj-TcGOndyCIwqU0gA.text: This is one of our favorite places in Singapore. The crowd is a bit raucous, the music is loud, the art is fantastic and if you are a music or film buff you may find some quotable quotes on the tables or walls. The food is hot, greasy and spicy if you want it. The craft beers are quite good, although the draft selection was a bit lacking. Best part is if you come after 2230 you stand a chance to get a discount on your food. High recommend for late night eats!

HuOMzkU0Fkkj7biKU8lKkw.text: I love coming to Duxton Hill. It's always bustling with people, there are so many restaurants to try, and it's the perfect precursor to a night out. So when I chanced upon Meatliquor, I was quite excited. The vibe is grungy and cool, and the food is pretty decent. My husband had the green chili burger and he devoured it within minutes. I had the hotdog and it was a bit much with the onions, chili, and jalapeños, but I'm sure others would love it!

g4uxRrLpRSQBDCQa1xyLAg.text: First of all, how does a bartender not know how to make Virgin Piña Colada? I ended up ordering a regular one and it had a very confusing taste.  We ordered five different cocktails on the menu and it was all D-. Definitely wouldn't go back for the drinks. We got Sambal Wings, which was dense with ingredients and not flavor, if that makes any sense. The Chili Cheese Fries was filled with instant mix flavor instead of the hearty homemade touch. The Chicken Burger, Cheeseburger, and Green Chili Burger were all quite mediocre. I give it a C.  The joint is fun and really loud and roaming with people and the staff was really friendly but the food wasn't up to par. If you really want to try it, I suggest you order Onion Rings and some beer to be safe.

3Ks-BL70VZ98Z5uRWtHcgw.text: Super cool looking place. I had walked by it the night before and knew I'd have to try it out. Cool atmosphere, great music, and good food, but way too overpriced. $50+ for a burger, fries and one bottle of beer is just ridiculous. I know Singapore is an expensive place, but this just seemed a little overboard. The burger was really good but the fries were forgettable. Cool place to hang, but just too expensive for what it ultimately is, a burger place. Maybe I'm just spoiled in Canada.
